item.title: PEAK: How to Get the Resourcefulness Badge
item.description:
The viral co-op climbing game PEAK has just received its first big update. Players got new materials to try, new achievements, and more ways to customize characters. One of these new achievements is called Resourcefulness.

Resourcefulness is one of the funniest (and most evil) achievements in the game. Your friends might not be too happy with you when you complete it, but once you pull it off, you’ll earn a cool cosmetic as a reward. This guide details how to unlock the Resourcefulness badge in PEAK .

How To Earn PEAK’s Resourcefulness Badge

To earn the Resourcefulness badge, the game asks you to ‘give in to your hunger.’ And yes, that means exactly what you think. It wants you to eat your friends .

This slightly disturbing feature was added in the July 29 update. PEAK players can now eat their teammates to fill their hunger bar. Wait until your hunger drops to about 60% , then walk up to a friend. Weirdly enough, they will now look like a chicken to you. Just press the button that you see on your screen.

Eating your teammate will, unsurprisingly, kill them instantly. But it will also give you a big stamina boost. On the plus side, you can pick up all the items they were carrying. Don’t worry, though; it’s not permanent. They can still be revived using a Scout Effigy or by interacting with the statue at the top of a biome.

One thing to keep in mind is that you will get hit with the Curse status effect afterward, which can be pretty annoying. It’s not fun, but it’s not the end of the world either.

The easiest way to cure it is to use a Cure-All , which removes Curse and any other debuffs you might have. PEAK fans can also try Pandora’s Lunchbox , but it’s a gamble. The lunchbox does wipe all your current debuffs, but it might give you new ones. These new effects could be good, or they could make your life even harder, so only use it if you are feeling lucky (or desperate).

If your character is hungry, but your teammate is not turning into a chicken, it probably means the cannibalism feature is turned off. You can switch it on from the main menu , earn the badge, and then turn it off again if you want to keep things friendly.

Resourcefulness Badge Reward in PEAK

When you complete this mischievous achievement, you’ll earn the Evil Smile cosmetic . It’s a perfectly fitting reward. An evil smile for a truly evil deed.

5 Images
5 Images

item.title: Destiny 2: Xur Exotic Armor, Weapon, and Recommendations for August 15
item.description:
Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. The final few days of the Solstice Event in Destiny 2 have arrived, with players having a limited time to unlock any of the exclusive rewards and gear, like the beach-themed armor, earning the full Lustrous set, and finding the perfect roll for the Fortunate Star, Festival Flight, or Yeartide Apex weapons.

In addition to frequent Destiny 2 updates, Bungie continues to look towards the future, specifically with player buildcrafting. Recently, Bungie teased some of its upcoming plans inside of the Ash & Iron update set for September, which brings with it a major update. Specifically, Bungie plans to tune abilities and aspects for Warlocks to offer players more variety when playing by buffing Threadlings, Weavewalk, Frostpulse, and more.

For now, the weekend merchant Xur is back with a new inventory of gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of August 15, 2025.

Where is Xur?

Xur has now taken up permanent residence in the Bazaar area inside The Tower, so there's no more hunting when the weekend comes around.

Since the Bazaar is located between both fast travel points, players can pick either one to load into. Head into the area where Ikora and Hawthorne are and look for the Ramen Shop towards the back wall. While facing the shop, the alley is to the right, where Xur is standing.

Destiny 2 Class Armor

Starting with the Edge of Fate expansion, Xur's role in the Tower has expanded a bit. While Xur no longer carries legendary armor, the merchant has increased his exotic offering by selling two pieces of gear for each class each week. Xur's new Destiny 2 inventory can still be found at the Tower Bazaar.

Xur's Exotic Armor

Skull of Dire Ahamkara - Warlock helmet

Exotic Perk :

  • Actual Grandeur - Provides additional damage resistance during Nova Bomb. Nova Bomb final blows and weapon final blows while you have Devour grant Super energy.

Stat Values (59 Total):

  • Health +19
  • Melee +29
  • Grenade +11
  • Super +0
  • Class +0
  • Weapons +0

Ballidorse Wrathweavers - Warlock leg armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Hearts of Ice - Targets frozen by your Winter's Wrath Super take increased Shatter damage. Allies in range of your Winter's Wrath shockwave and Frostpulse gain Frost Armor and deal increased damage with Stasis weapons. Granting these buffs to allies grants you Super energy.

Stat Values (58 Total):

  • Health +29
  • Melee +0
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +11
  • Class +18
  • Weapons +0

Speedloader Slacks - Hunter leg armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Tight Fit - Dodging instantly reloads all your weapons and grants increased reload and handling to you and nearby allies. While the buff is active, additional dodges increase the buff strength and refresh the timer, maxing out at 5 stacks. Dealing sustained damage grants class ability energy.

Stat Values (61 Total):

  • Health +30
  • Melee +0
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +0
  • Class +19
  • Weapons +12

Assassin's Cowl - Hunter helmet

Exotic Perk :

  • Vanishing Execution - Powered melee final blows grant invisibility and restore a portion of health and shields. Finishers and final blows against more powerful targets increase the duration of the invisibility and the amount of health and shields restored.

Stat Values (59 Total):

  • Health +0
  • Melee +0
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +12
  • Class +29
  • Weapons +18

Ashen Wake - Titan gauntlets

Exotic Perk :

  • Bring the Heat - Fusion Grenades gain increased throw speed, explode on impact, and stun Unstoppable Champions. Final blows with Fusion Grenades grant grenade energy.

Stat Values (61 total):

  • Health +0
  • Melee +19
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +29
  • Class +13
  • Weapons +0

Cadmus Ridge Lancecap - Titan helmet

Exotic Perk :

  • Lancer's Vigil - Thrown Diamond Lances create Stasis crystals, with more created by hitting bosses and vehicles. While a Stasis Super is equipped, rapid precision hits and precision final blows from behind a Rally Barricade will create a Diamond Lance near you.

Stat Values (62 Total):

  • Health +20
  • Melee +30
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +0
  • Class +12
  • Weapons +0

Xur Inventory Items

Year 7 in Destiny 2 has upgraded Xur's inventory, adding a true rank progression system, rewards, as well as focusing options. Xur also has more than just weapons and armor as well, including:

  • Izanagi's Burden Catalyst
  • Lumina Catalyst
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Ascendant Shard
  • Glimmer
  • Enhancement Core
  • Raid Banner (7 for 11 Strange Coins)
  • Favor of the Nine
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)

Exotic Ciphers

  • Xenology - Complete activities in the Portal with a performance grade B or higher. Additional progress is awarded for better performance grades, activities with a longer average duration, and for succeeding with clanmates.

Xur's Exotic Weapons

Here is what Xur has this weekend for exotic weapons:

Hawkmoon - Hand Cannon

  • Paracausal Shot - Final blows and precision hits with Hawkmoon grant stacks of Paracausal Charge. The final round in the magazine deals bonus damage based on the number of stacks. Stowing Hawkmoon on the final round removes this bonus.
  • Smallbore
  • Alloy Magazine
  • Snapshot Sights
  • Polymer Grip

The Huckleberry - SMG

  • Ride the Bull - Increases rate of fire and recoil while you're holding down the trigger. Final blows dealt with this weapon reload the magazine.
  • Rampage - Kills with this weapon temporarily grant increased damage. Stacks 3x.
  • Fluted Barrel
  • Ricochet Rounds
  • Short-Action Stock

Prometheus Lens - Trace Rifle

  • Prismatic Inferno - Fires a Solar trace beam that creates a field of heat energy that grows as the weapon is fired. Sustained damage applies scorch to the target.
  • Flame Refraction - Kills with this weapon return a fraction of the ammo used to the magazine from reserves, extending the beam's duration.
  • Chambered Compensator
  • Projection Fuse
  • Composite Stock

Thunderlord - Machine Gun

  • Reign Havoc - Final blows with this weapon generate stunning lighting strikes from above. Lightning strikes grant a stack of Bolt Charge. Strong against [Disruption] Overload Champions.
  • Feeding Frenzy - Each rapid kill with this weapon progressively increases reload speed for a short time.
  • Polygonal Rifling
  • Armor-Piercing Rounds
  • Lightning Rounds

Xur's Destiny 2 Legendary Weapons

Xur's Set of Legendary Weapons. All weapons cost 17 Strange Coins.

  • Warden's Law (Kinetic Hand Cannon)
  • Aisha's Care (Kinetic Pulse Rifle)
  • Rake Angle (Kinetic Glaive)
  • Jian 7 Rifle (Energy Auto Rifle)
  • First In, Last Out (Energy Shotgun)
  • Far Future (Energy Sniper Rifle)
  • Shattered Cipher (Heavy Machine Gun)
  • BrayTech Osprey (Adept Heavy Rocket Launcher)
  • Memory Interdict (Heavy Grenade Launcher)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram (7 Strange Coins)

Play Destiny 2: The Edge of Fate. Guardians will track a mysterious signal to a location at the edge of the solar system, where they will uncover a truth that redefines their future.

The Future Is Now - A new adventure and the start of a new saga in Destiny 2. World tiers allow Guardians to select the level of difficulty that is right for them and reap the rewards that come with victory. Higher tiers offer more challenge, additional narrative threads, new secrets to uncover, and more powerful gear to collect.

Access Kepler’s Secrets - Hidden deep within the Reef, a new destination awaits: the mysterious planetoid of Kepler. Explore a lost human settlement and forgotten Fallen houses, and encounter new characters, all affected by a mysterious Anomaly that has twisted the destination into something menacing.

Destination Abilities - Push the limit of your Guardian’s capabilities and unlock the mysteries of Kepler with new destination abilities, powered by the mysterious Anomaly.

New Foes - Two new enemy combatants have entered the fray. Cut down swarming masses of Vex drones known as Kobolds, and face diabolical hovering Fallen Corsairs, each intent on standing in the way of your success.

item.title: New Skate Game Details Seasonal Content Model, Early Access, and More
item.description:
Electronic Arts has shared a big batch of new info about Skate , detailing the game's customization options, live-service content model, and soundtrack, among other elements. The move arrives mere weeks ahead of Skate 's early access launch.

The fourth mainline entry in the long-dormant skateboarding franchise, Skate is developed by EA's Vancouver-based Full Circle Studio. It was originally announced in June 2020 and later confirmed to have been envisioned as a free-to-play live-service offering. The game is currently planned to launch in early access in late summer 2025, though its exact release date is still pending confirmation. As of today, it's already in closed alpha.

The Skate team has now reaffirmed the game's late summer launch, in addition to sharing some more details about what fans can expect from its early access phase as part of its latest developer diary, officially called The Grind: Vol. 5. The main takeaways from the new info batch include the confirmation of a robust character customization system, over 100 music tracks, and an evolving seasonal content model.

Skate Promises In-Depth Customization

As is to be expected from a live-service title, customization will be an integral part of the upcoming game. In addition to a robust character creator allowing for countless combinations, Skate players will be able to dress their character from head to toe and go wild with skateboard customization. Cosmetics will be unlockable through activity rewards and purchases. Completing Challenges and Mission will reward Rip Chips, a special currency not obtainable any other way. RCs can be used to open loot boxes to get random gear and up one's Rip Score, which will help with unlocking even more clothing and equipment, including hats, helmets, shoes, pants, deck sticks, and grip tape.

Skate Soundtrack Aims To Showcase Emerging Artists

Skate 's soundtrack has been confirmed to feature over 100 tracks at launch. The game will aim to showcase emerging artists, and will also allow players to favorite songs and playlists. Top community picks will be featured as part of the ever-evolving San Van Jams playlist. Some tracks will be collectible within the game world, hidden in locations such as cars and skate spots, and can be picked up with a button prompt. More music will be added to Skate as the game evolves, being planned to arrive as part of regular seasonal content drops.

Skate Soundtrack: Confirmed Artists

  • Turnstile
  • Denzel Curry
  • Little Simz
  • Skeggs
  • Earth Wind & Fire
  • MF Doom

Skate Seasons Will Be Around 3 Months Long

Besides music, future Skate seasons will introduce new events, cosmetics, features, and even changes to the game's world. Limited-time content will be unlockable via a battle pass system called Skate Pass, which will have both free and paid tiers. Full Circle plans each season to be around three months long, so that it can hold four per year on average. The first season will kick off shortly after Skate launches in early access at the end of summer. More information on this front is promised to arrive as part of The Grind: Vol. 6 in September 2025. In the meantime, Full Circle has confirmed that Skate 's early access will be entirely free to play, much like the game itself, and that it will support up to 150 players per server.

item.title: Games With The Most Competitive Communities
item.description:
Summary

  • Games like Rocket League, Counter-Strike, and League of Legends have intense, competitive communities.
  • Matches in these games can get toxic due to demands for perfection and intense rivalries.
  • Players use advanced techniques to dominate in games like Super Smash Bros. and Tekken, turning casual matches into intense competitions.

Games that push players to improve their skills and become more competent than ever are bound to have intense communities. These players want to be the very best in their respective games and end up getting highly competitive during games.

This is especially true in the case of multiplayer games, with the act of battling human opponents being quite compelling. Players who are new to these games should be ready to get cussed out from time to time because of how intense and competitive the matchups can be.

Rocket League

People Get Really Serious About Playing Soccer With Robot Cars

Rocket League
22
8.5 /10
Released
July 7, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Mild Lyrics
Powered by

Rocket League is one of the greatest multiplayer games around. No one knew that playing soccer with cars would be so riveting that this game would turn into an e-sports mainstay with one of the most active communities around.

It also features some very salty and competitive players who refuse to accept anything other than perfection. Spamming chat with sarcastic compliments has become a meme at this point, making it clear that teams that don't gel with each other are bound to get under everyone's skin.

Counter-Strike 2

The Community Can Get Toxic At Times

Counter-Strike 2
12
8.2 /10
Released
September 27, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Counter-Strike is one of the greatest video games ever made, with players loving how tense the matchups in this game are. The tactical shootouts make for fun casual matchups until player step up to the big leagues and become aware of their ELO rankings.

It's here that players demand perfection from their teammates if they want to be ranked as some of the best Counter-Strike players in the entire world. This can lead to toxic moments where players can't stop disparaging teammates who make a single mistake, highlighting just how intense a round of Counter-Strike can be.

League Of Legends

The Poster Child Of Toxic, Competitive Communities

League of Legends
11
6.7 /10
Released
October 27, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco
Powered by

The poster child of toxic and competitive gaming communities, League of Legends can be brutal on beginners who get paired up with people who don't appreciate their lack of skills. The journey from a noob to a seasoned LoL player is long but satisfying once players get a hang of the heroes they love.

Even then, every round of League of Legends is a lengthy, sweaty affair where a single mistake can have dire consequences. Players must become adept at using heroes and coordinate with their teammates if they don't want to lose a tense match.

Valorant

The Counter-Strike DNA Ensures That Matches Are As Sweaty As They Come

Valorant
11
7.9 /10
Released
June 2, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Violence
Powered by

It's only a given that a game with Counter-Strike DNA is bound to have a competitive community that wants its team to be as perfect as possible. This is why Valorant makes for such a riveting time as players come to grips with the abilities of every character in this hero shooter.

Eventually, players will become adept and this game and demand perfection from their teammates. Carrying a team is fine and all, but there are only so many times a skilled player can aid others before they eventually battle against another ridiculously strong team.

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate

The Competitiveness Of The SSB Community Is Well-Documented

6 Images
6 Images
Super Smash Bros. Ultimate
9 /10
18
8.9 /10
Released
December 7, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Cartoon Violence, Comic Mischief, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

The Super Smash Bros. was a hit right from its inception, with players desperate to answer playground squabbles about which crossover characters would win in a fight. While games like Ultimate are perfect to whip out at parties, players who want to get serious about playing this game will find out just how challenging things can get.

Players know so many advanced techniques that are bound to frustrate casuals. This is why a fight between pros is so much fun to watch, with the competitive e-sports community making it clear just how tense a match in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate can get.

Tekken 8

All Fighting Games Are Highly Competitive, And Tekken Is No Exception

Tekken 8
9 /10
18
8.4 /10
Released
January 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Tekken is among the most beloved fighting game franchises of all time, with each entry allowing players to hone their skills and figure out the best way to frustrate their opponents. Online matchups are sweaty affairs as players put it all on the line to improve their skills.

Players will eventually land upon a few favorite characters they'll use time and time again to smite their foes. During competitive matchups against equally skilled opposition, every hit counts and leads to players either savoring a hard-fought victory or licking their wounds after a crushing loss.

EA Sports FC 25

A Sports Game Series Known For Tense Matchups

EA Sports FC 25
33
7.1 /10
Released
September 27, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone // Alcohol And Tobacco Reference, Users Interact, In-Game Purchases (Includes Random Items)
Powered by

It's only a given that every EA sports game is bound to have intensely competitive communities, and EA Sports FC 25 is no exception. The popularity of modes like Ultimate Team and the need to have the best team make it clear why players drop so much money on this mode.

It's just one of the many ways EA Sports FC 25 compels players to become as skilled in this game as possible. The various multiplayer modes ensure that every victory against a tough team feels like a major achievement.

Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6

The CoD Community Is Obsessive About Winning And K/D Ratios

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
9 /10
193
7.4 /10
Released
October 25, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Suggestive Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

A huge reason why Call of Duty became so popular is because of its intense multiplayer. Players love the intense matchups in various multiplayer modes where they try to improve their K/D ratio and ensure that their team comes out victorious against challenging opposition.

Black Ops 6 is no exception here, with players honing their skills and doing everything in their power to attain victories. From cowardly camping strategies to being a whizz on the battlefield, the sense of progression players enjoy as they play numerous rounds of intense multiplayer matches never gets old.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Reveals Community Companion Winner
item.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley has revealed the final design of the winning creature in its Community Companion contest, which has been going on throughout the summer. There's still no official word on when the contest champion will make its debut in Disney Dreamlight Valley , so players may want to keep their eyes peeled for game updates.

In addition to filling roles as adorable pets that players can collect, Companions in the fanciful life simulation adventure game provide many of the same benefits as regular Villagers. They can gain friendship levels with the player, with increasing levels resulting in expanded inventory slots, the collection of bonus resources, and at the peak of friendship, clothing and furniture rewards. There are currently around 150 different animal Companions in Disney Dreamlight Valley , including 26 that players have been able to acquire from past special events, and even a few special inorganic additions, like the footstool from Beauty and the Beast and the Star Wars universe's R2-D2.

Disney Dreamlight Valley Reveals Its First Community Companion

Now, a new addition to the Companion ranks has been revealed following the Disney Dreamlight Valley Community Companion voting that started in early June. Five initial rounds of voting determined that the new Companion would be a cottagecore dragon with a floral aesthetic, and a more recent poll, which wrapped up on August 11, asked players to select between three designs that the development team had cooked up based on those parameters. Officially announced on August 15, the grand winner, with 66 percent of votes claimed, is a pink, Eastern-style dragon with a cherry blossom motif, which beat out the second-place sunflower dragon and the third-place fall leaf-themed dragon. Tiny cherry blossoms adorn its branch-like brown horns, while its wings resume larger blooms, and its scales are reminiscent of flower petals.

Now that the game's first Community Companion has been decided, many players wonder how will be able to get their hands on it. Companions are often only available through Disney Dreamlight Valley 's Premium Shop, but there are other ways of acquiring them, such as completing special quests or, in the case of the Ancient Robot, crafting them.

Since this is the first Companion to have been created through a collaborative voting effort with the game's player community, there is also the possibility that the developers could reward players by giving this dragon a special set of skills. While most Companions share similar functional traits, The Little Mermaid 's Max the sheepdog broke this trend when he was introduced in June, with the ability to dig up resources from the ground, special interactions with Ariel and Eric, and some unique poses in the game's photo mode.
